notes:
The "Fatal Error" is not related to Proton, and a fix is described here: https://steamcommunity.com/app/424840/discussions/0/1318836262662882743/
I don't know how to pull that one off in proton, though, because it includes launching another process using the pid of the former. Any help is appreciated

gpu: X.Org Radeon RX 570 Series (POLARIS10, DRM 3.26.0, 4.18.6-arch1-1-ARCH, LLVM 6.0.1)

title: Little Nightmares

gpu: Intel Open Source Technology Center Mesa DRI Intel(R) Ivybridge Mobile x86/MMX/SSE2
title: Little Nightmares

notes: -onethread and installing xact makes it launch perfectly, but you find many instances were the game crashes or goes into a 1fps stutter until you close it. ie: using the button on the big eye room, jumping over the retractable bed. I guess it has to do with using just one thread, so my new rating is a solid Bronze, as it is still pretty much broken
title: Little Nightmares

cpu: CPU 品牌：Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-7700 CPU @ 3.60GHz
gpu: 驅動程式：NVIDIA Corporation GeForce GTX 1070/PCIe/SSE2
title: Little Nightmares

notes: After playing using 3.7-7 Beta for nearly 3 hours, it looks like the crashes are gone, although performance drops are still here and there with some heavy effects like the mirror reflection and the big eye screen. -onethread and xact
title: Little Nightmares

notes: Using "-onethread" as launch parameter is necessary. To fix crackling audio install "xact" with "winetricks" and set "xaudio2_6" & "xaudio2_7" to native.
title: Little Nightmares

gpu: X.Org AMD Radeon (TM) RX 480 Graphics (POLARIS10, DRM 3.26.0, 4.18.11-arch1-1-ARCH, LLVM 8.0.0)
notes: Game only works when setting the launch parameter "-onethread", sounds is crackling maybe because of the one thread limit.
title: Little Nightmares

gpu: AMD Radeon R9 Nano (FIJI, DRM 3.26.0, LLVM 6.0.1)

title: Little Nightmares
